f6_assessments.q0:
Even though the proposal is partially aligned with the goals of the challenge, which is the joint growth of Cardano together with Africa in order to address one of the main concerns of the continent, namely education, in my opinion the proposal should be further developed so that the proposed actions achieve the intended effect. First of all, in the problem statement we only find some general data on how the province of North Kivu is composed, stating as a problem that they have been victims of atrocities. Although this information serves to give us some context, this problem is beyond our reach to solve. I would suggest adding in the articulation of the problem, what are the effects of the situation reported and its influence on education, which is really the problem that I understand is intended to be addressed in the proposal. Further, I would have liked a more detailed explanation of the differentiating factors provided from the adoption of the Cardano ecosystem and its sustainability. This is because, at present, I only observe the project team's intention to use it as a cryptocurrency through a traditional method of receiving funds. While this would increase wallet activity, there is much more potential in Cardano to exploit with this proposal.
Therefore, I would like to suggest that the author provide us with more details of the 12 listening sessions they plan to conduct on the use of Cardano. If the content of such trainings is of high impact and has the potential to engage people into our ecosystem, then it would add value to the proposal.
Finally, for the purposes of introducing another example of the potential that could be leveraged to maximize the impact of this proposal, I would like to mention the possibility of using solutions that allow you to have verifiable data of the 205 children and families benefited, with governance and/or digital identities built on Cardano, such as Atala PRISM (https://atalaprism.io/). Thus, we would not only be guaranteeing the use of ADA but also contributing to the scalability of the use of the ecosystem in Africa.
f6_assessments.q1:
In order to better understand the project team, I would like to request links or detailed references to their experience with concrete examples of their most significant accomplishments, which would help us to endorse that they possess the necessary skills to successfully complete this proposal. For example, they refer to Apolinnaire SENZIBERA and indicate that he has a lot of experience in mushroom culture. An individual's definition of "many years of experience" may vary from 5 years to 25 years or more for another. So, my recommendation is to be as specific as possible. Also, in one part of the proposal they mention that a social supervisor will make visits to validate that the planned activities are being carried out. However, we do not know who this person is and what is his/her relevant experience for this function.
Regarding the budget, it is recommended to detail the line items and break it down into clearly identifiable elements. For example, $8400 is allocated for Staff Salary and it would be advisable to identify who is part of that staff and to break down the pay rate of each one of them, in order to know if it is in accordance with their responsibilities. Regarding the $5500 for identification and beneficiary selection, I would suggest to identify the individuals who will be performing the identification and what the amount will be for each, as well as how many people will be traveling and how many trips there will be, so that we can estimate their unit cost. Following these guidelines with all the concepts of the budget, besides making it auditable, facilitates the understanding of the scope, and will help the team to monitor the cash flow once they obtain the funds.
Finally, I see the need for the proposer to describe in more depth the tasks that compose the solution that is being proposed. For example, the proposer indicates that they will conduct 12 training sessions on the operation of blockchain cardano systems for beneficiaries and their parents for 205 families. Then, please comment on what is the agenda for these trainings, if they are already prepared or need to be created. If the material is not ready, how much time and resources will be needed to develop it, who will deliver the sessions and what is their relevant experience, what will be the duration of such activity, if they already have the appropriate location with capacity for the target number of people, if there is a cost for such location, among others. 
Until we can have more details of the execution plan of the proposal and its budget, I strongly disagree the project is feasible.
f6_assessments.q2: Although the proponent describes the results that are expected to be achieved in a 6-month period, in order to be successful it must be clarified what are the milestones that will help us identify at any time during those 6 months, whether the project is on track or not. For example, they plan to conduct 12 training sessions on the operation of blockchain cardano systems for beneficiaries and their parents for 205 families. So, my recommendation would be to break down these 12 training sessions into a schedule for those 6 months, for example: 4 sessions by month #2, 4 sessions by month #4 and 4 sessions by month #6. That way, if 2 months have already passed and only 1 session has been completed, we will know that we are behind schedule, and corrective actions can be taken in time. Then, it is necessary to accompany the plan with specific KPIs that also alert us of any deviation, as well as serve to let the community know the progress of the proposal to encourage its replication at other locations. An example of KPIs could be: the number of attendees to the training sessions (to measure the engagement rate), the number of applicants to the program (to determine the target and potential population in future cycles), the number of schools enrolled in the program (to measure the reach), among others. In conclusion, the proponent should work on the above mentioned points in order to be able to assess the progress of the proposal in attaining its stated goals.

f6_assessments.q0: This project aims to provide a solution to the problem faced by Nort Kivu, one of the provinces in the east of DR Congo with an area of 5948 km2 and 6 administrations. For more than decades, this province has been the victim of various atrocities that have a traumatic effect on the affected children. The proposal aims to ensure through a school care project that affected children are registered in the cardano system in a reliable database in order to help them further. This will certainly add value to the cardano ecosystem.ISDR-GL is a higher development institution with a vocation to train secondary school graduates. It has already produced and placed more than 8,740 graduates in the workforce who are thriving with proven experiences. Students have a test field, library, laboratory.The proposal clearly outlines how they will identify and select those in need, based on established criteria.It should be noted that each payment is dependent on opening an individual wallet and the currency will be released in crypto monaie and therefore to ADA for its promotion. It also describes the authorities with which close cooperation will take place and how and when reports will be made, as well as the expected results. This project can certainly be successful.
